1:
He who lives in the shelter of the Most High
\q will stay in the shadow of the Almighty.
\q
2:
I will say of Yahweh, "He is my refuge and my fortress,
\q my God, in whom I trust."
3:
For he will rescue you from the snare of the hunter
\q and from the deadly plague.
\q
4:
He will cover you with his wings,
\q and under his wings you will find refuge.
\q His trustworthiness is a shield and protection.
5:
You will not be afraid of terror in the night,
\q or of the arrow that flies by day,
\q
6:
or of the plague that roams around in the darkness,
\q or of the disease that comes at noontime.
\q
7:
A thousand may fall at your side
\q and ten thousand at your right hand,
\q but it will not reach you.
8:
You will only observe
\q and see the punishment of the wicked.
\q
9:
For Yahweh is my refuge!
\q Make the Most High your refuge also.
11:
For he will direct his angels to protect you,
\q to guard you in all your ways.
12:
They will lift you up with their hand
\q so that you will not hit your foot on a stone.
\q
13:
You will crush lions and adders under your feet;
\q you will trample on young lions and serpents.
14:
Because he is devoted to me, I will rescue him.
\q I will protect him because he is loyal to me.
\q
15:
When he calls to me, I will answer him.
\q I will be with him in trouble;
\q I will give him victory and will honor him.
\q
16:
I will satisfy him with long life
\q and show him my salvation.
